oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LOCAL APPROXIMATIONS : A NEW WAY OF DEALING WITH IRREGULAR WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nielsen, Peter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: irregular waves
dealing with waves
local approximations
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The concept of local approximations via locally defined frequencies is introduced as a tool for dealing with irregular, non linear waves. Practical testing has been performed on the problem of estimating surface elevations from measured bottom pressures. In these tests the new method even in its simplest form proves more accurate than the linear spectral method. With respect to computational effort the new method requires orders of magnitude less than spectral methods, or wave by wave analysis of similar accuracy.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 20 (1986): Proceedings of 20th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Taipei, Taiwan, 1986.; 48
